## Coherency Updates

The following updates ensure that dependencies with a *CoherentParentDependency*
attribute were produced in a build used as input to the parent dependency's build.
See [Dependency Description Format](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/master/Documentation/DependencyDescriptionFormat.md#dependency-description-overview)

Issues.Title: [dnceng-bot] Branch `wpf/release/9.0` can't be merged to Azdo internal branch
Issues.Body:
Branch [release/9.0](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/commits/release/9.0/) in `dotnet/wpf` repo can't be mirrored from GitHub to Azure [internal/release/9.0](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-wpf?version=GBinternal%2Frelease%2F9.0&_a=history) via internal merge. 

There are conflicting commits in the target branch.
The branch is configured to be mirrored via automated merge. 
The situation is rare but normal. The target branch is expected to receive manual commits in the Azure DevOps clone, which could cause conflict.

Conflicts need to be **resolved to unblock the code flow**.

- you can resolve the issue by resolving the conflict in the **target branch only**. 
    - Please make sure that the changes sensitive from security perspective are not published ahead of time to GitHub!
- reverting the extra commits in the Azdo target branch.
- checking the logs of the mirroring process in the [mirroring pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build?definitionId=1387).
- you can disable the mirroring of the branch in the [configuration file](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-mirroring?path=/dnceng-subscriptions.jsonc).
- you can ask @dotnet/dnceng for help or read the [documentation](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-mirroring?path=/README.md).

Please close this issue once the conflict is resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[dnceng-bot] Branch `wpf/release/9.0` can't be merged to Azdo internal branch" (#10582)

Issues.Title: Adding style for Frame in fluent
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10576 

## Description

Frame in WPF is a navigation control that allows displaying different Page content within an application. It supports forward and backward navigation, history management

This PR adds styling for Frame in fluent
## Customer Impact

<!-- What is the impact to customers of not taking this fix? -->

## Regression

No
## Testing

Local build pass, tested with sample applications
## Risk

<!-- Please assess the risk of taking this fix. Provide details backing up your assessment. -->

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Adding style for Frame in fluent" (#10577)

Issues.Title: Fixing button border brush and other resource usage
Issues.Body:
Fixes # <!-- Issue Number --> #9886 

## Description
Button styles were using the common / Fluent brushes directly rather than Button's control brushes like ButtonBorderBrush, ButtonBorderBrushPointerOver, etc.

In this PR, I have fixed the Button styles to use the Button control brushes correctly.

## Customer Impact
Developers will be able to modify the Button control brushes without affecting other controls.

## Regression
No

## Testing
Local testing

## Risk
No
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/10578)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fixing button border brush and other resource usage" (#10578)

Issues.Title: Fix Fluent elevation control BorderBrushes
Issues.Body:
### Description

During .NET 9, we had to workaround the control elevation border brushes for different themes. Here are the things that's needed to be fixed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix Fluent elevation control BorderBrushes" (#10568)

Issues.Title: Expander cannot shrink in time
Issues.Body:
### Description

I used the new UI theme for wpf in. NET 9.
When I have multiple expanders in my itemcontrol, shrink one and his menu shrinks back, but **it takes several seconds to retract his position.**

### Reproduction Steps

  <ItemsControl
      BorderThickness="0"
      FocusVisualStyle="{x:Null}"
      ItemsSource="{Binding SelectedItem.Items}">
      <ItemsControl.ItemTemplate>
          <DataTemplate>
              <Expander
                  Margin="0"
                  Background="Transparent"
                  FocusVisualStyle="{x:Null}"
                  IsExpanded="{Binding IsSelected, Mode=TwoWay, UpdateSourceTrigger=PropertyChanged}">
                  <Expander.Header>
                      <DockPanel>
                          <TextBlock
                              VerticalAlignment="Center"
                              FontSize="14"
                              Foreground="#212529"
                              Text="{Binding Title}" />
                      </DockPanel>
                  </Expander.Header>

               
                  <!--<ListView
                      x:Name="LastView"
                      Margin="10,0"
                      FocusVisualStyle="{x:Null}"
                      ItemsSource="{Binding Items}">
                      <i:Interaction.Triggers>
                          <i:EventTrigger EventName="SelectionChanged">
                              <i:InvokeCommandAction Command="{Binding DataContext.NavigateCommand, RelativeSource={RelativeSource AncestorType=Window}}" CommandParameter="{Binding ElementName=LastView, Path=SelectedItem}" />
                          </i:EventTrigger>
                      </i:Interaction.Triggers>
                      <ListView.ItemTemplate>
                          <DataTemplate>
                              <TextBlock Margin="5,0" Text="{Binding Title}" />
                          </DataTemplate>
                      </ListView.ItemTemplate>
                  </ListView>-->
                  
              </Expander>
          </DataTemplate>
      </ItemsControl.ItemTemplate>
  </ItemsControl>

### Expected behavior

I hope to be able to recover the space occupied by Expander's content very quickly when shrinking.

### Actual behavior

There are no error messages, it just takes a few seconds to refresh the layout, which is very unfriendly.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Expander cannot shrink in time" (#10558)

Issues.Title: [ Fluent ] Elevation brushes for Light / Dark theme use Relative mode instead of Absolute and RelativeTransform.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[ Fluent ] Elevation brushes for Light / Dark theme use Relative mode instead of Absolute and RelativeTransform." (#10569)

Issues.Title: Fixed elevation border brush for Light and Dark theme
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10569 

## Description
Since #10502 is fixed now, I have raised this PR to fix the elevation brushes for Light and Dark themes. Elevation brushes use RelativeTransform alongwith an Absolute mode LinearGradientBrush. 


## Customer Impact
Fixes Fluent theme resources 

## Regression
No
<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->

## Testing
Local testing
<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

## Risk
Minimal
<!-- Please assess the risk of taking this fix. Provide details backing up your assessment. -->

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/10567)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fixed elevation border brush for Light and Dark theme" (#10567)

Issues.Title: Fluent2 ComboBox Missing Scrollbars
Issues.Body:
### Description

This one is strange -- things like this are why we REALLY need to rebase all the control styles on WinUI directly. Mistakes like this just shouldn't have happened. Anyway, the ScrollViewer scrollbars in the ComboBox are disabled (Hidden):

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/7df0d6dd0f6d8ec154a3884a37740e93f30c701f/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Themes/PresentationFramework.Fluent/Styles/ComboBox.xaml#L156-L157

### Reproduction Steps

See Fluent theme ComboBox

### Expected behavior

See Aero2 theme:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/7df0d6dd0f6d8ec154a3884a37740e93f30c701f/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/Themes/PresentationFramework.Aero2/Themes/Aero2.NormalColor.xaml#L7787-L7788

Or WinUI theme:
https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/247d04e06b711610cbaa7b6302f2f9d67779988d/src/controls/dev/ComboBox/ComboBox_themeresources.xaml#L368-L369

At least the vertical scrollbars should be `Auto`. It's probably fine to leave horizontal disabled.


### Actual behavior

Scrollbars are completely disabled in Fluent ComboBoxes

### Regression?

Yes

### Known Workarounds

Modify the style per-control

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fluent2 ComboBox Missing Scrollbars" (#10571)

Issues.Title: LocalizedControlType translation missing
Issues.Body:
### Description

LocalizedControlType translation missing

### Reproduction Steps

please refer to src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/UIAutomation/UIAutomationTypes/Resources


### Expected behavior

LocalizedControlType should be translated to each languages.

### Actual behavior

LocalizedControlType didn't be translated to each languages.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

No

### Impact

Controls can not be read by the screen reader correctly.

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

The translation exist in the .net framework.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "LocalizedControlType translation missing" (#10557)
